fyi,
Customer still didn't have clear understanding how the web service they are designing (for fetching data via FDM) will work and if it will have capability to filter data or not. I would like to wait for their clear requirement before jumping to the strategy.

I am trying to get more details around this from last 2-3 meeting but I think still now they haven't analysed it in detail.

For Pre-rendering scenario - they already have one UI at their to do data filtering and they want to get the data from fdm and list sections present in data and they do preview with selected data from the list.

> Pre-rendering scenario - NFCU wants pdf preview with filtered data, which they get from FDM. They want to render only a section of a template using the part of data they select.
If the aim is to filter/process the data fetched from FDM and before it is used for rendering the PDF then it can be done by using FDM Post processor which is already available. Adding <@WLWHN4TV3> to confirm it.

> Post-rendering scenario - They want to use the rendered letter/pdf for archival or send via email to users.
There are 2 ways to handle it
• Invoke HTTP Api to render the IC print channel as pdf with data and then use the PDF and do post processing in customer application itself. 
• Use a workflow in AEM for rendition of IC print channel as PDF with data and then do further post-processing in subsequent workflow steps. Initiation of the workflow would be some event dependent. This will require us to support OOTB workflow step for IC rendition. 
Selection of approach will depend on the customer’s preference for where to post process the PDF.

<@WE163TH43>, do they prefer do it on AEM only? Did we discuss this?

Pre-rendering scenario -  NFCU wants pdf preview with filtered data, which they get from FDM. They want to render only a section of a template using the part of data they select.

Post-rendering scenario - They want to use the rendered letter/pdf for archival or send via email to users.

> I'm still not sure if saving as draft is the right solution. It seems more of a workaround as of now.
Ideally it should be solved with resiliency - but here it is a success for AEM - and backend call is success and fails in downstream..

> If it's a sync call
Sync-call it seems - as Shivendra mentioned that it fails 2-3 steps down their submission flow and AEM/user is not intimated..

If it's a sync call where the submission is failing then custom code should be improved to throw the exception to the source. In case of async calls this scenarios should not arise.
I'm still not sure if saving as draft is the right solution. It seems more of a workaround as of now.
They shared in last call that - at times submission failed 2-3 steps down the line - which end user/AEM is not aware of - and thus want to track all submissions - not just failing submissions.

> Shouldn't they be just implementing ETE form submit tests that run in their deployment pipeline?
+1 We did propose that.

To provide more context on the original issue...
>  When we were working with them on the VIP engagement - an incident happened when due to a code change - their service went down.. In VIP we helped make the code modular and readable - but due to that incident - they lost thousands of submissions in a few hours.
> With portal - they want to have a backup submission to draft - so that if something similar happens in future - they have the complete data - and can leverage to push data to original submit through manual process later on.

Just wondering if the problem can be with their code that results in submission failure then any customization for Save as draft code also may be prone to the failures (it seems they don't trust their code) 
Shouldn't they be just implementing ETE form submit tests that run in their deployment pipeline?

<@U04P75X4H1B> One thing which came to my mind, since they have PII concerns, data in Azure is by default encrypted at rest[0] and not in transit and in use. For transit we use https so we are good, and in use they can restrict the access to azure/blob/containers. Lets confirm with them once, if this works for them, if not then lets do pre-processor.
As during our call, they needed base 64 encoding which is not encryption and definitely will not resolve their PII concerns. And if preprocessor is encrypting form values and their rest service should decrypt that in same fashion and in that case they have to handle key management also.

[0] : <https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-service-encryption>

<@U0213T59LMN> They are submitting to rest api. They have written custom submission for this.

Current requirement is that they want to save that data with submission.

Here is the background for this requirement:
In past, their submission starts failing due to some issue in their code base and they almost lost 3k submissions. They were looking for some solution where they can save this data when submission happens so that if submission fails, they can get those drafts and submit by themselves. For this, we recommend save as draft feature to them. And, after the portal demo most of their requirements met, its just that they want to encrypt/encode this data before pushing it to Azure. To achieve this use case, we are thinking to try out FDM pre processor.

<@W4RSW3ECC> We are thinking to try out FDM pre processor for this.

<@U0213T59LMN> /<@W9QMZFR39>: Please find the package consisting of a Workflow Model catering to review and approval process for a form submission.

Here is a demo recording for the working of the WF model: <https://adobe-my.sharepoint.com/:v:/p/sakshatc/EapDE6bUy3xKjCfMBZkA8ZgBNlB4ZUzer9ccIO3tgvn5vg?nav=eyJyZWZlcnJhbEluZm8iOnsicmVmZXJyYWxBcHAiOiJPbmVEcml2ZUZvckJ1c2luZXNzIiwicmVmZXJyYWxBcHBQbGF0Zm9ybSI6IldlYiIsInJlZmVycmFsTW9kZSI6InZpZXciLCJyZWZlcnJhbFZpZXciOiJNeUZpbGVzTGlua0NvcHkifX0&e=5QHNaB|Custom_Approve_Review_Defer_Workflow.mov>
Currently, I've given view access to people in Adobe. Do let me know, if I've to add someone from outside the adobe domain.

Further context about the WF model: <https://cq-dev.slack.com/archives/C04D195JVGS/p1743694244944359>

> • Are there any sample OSGI workflows for review, approval and rejection that can be shared with the customer?
<@U05DURMMBGV>: Please share the workflow we created for Cintas as a package
> • Can a OSGI workflow invoke another OSGI workflow and pass data between them? Basically, a sub-workflow and wait for its execution. I know there is a container component but we need more clarity on this.
There is also a process step which wait for external process to complete and decide on the next action - we can get more details on this requirement.
> • How can failed workflow instances can be recovered? If an OSGI workflow execution fails, is there a way to recover them?
Failed workflows can be found in the failed workflow tabs and can be executed from the same failed step - if the requirement is to replay the complete wf then it is not available

Here are some features they're looking for:
• *Filling forms with information from an ID or document:* Automatically pre-fill forms using verified sources to save time and reduce errors.
• *Real-time monitoring:* Track form completion and drop-off rates in real-time to identify bottlenecks and optimize customer journeys.
• *Intent detection and automated guidance:* Use AI to detect customer intent and provide automated guidance, making the process more efficient and user-friendly.
• *Personalized enrollment journeys:* Use data-driven insights to create personalized experiences for each customer.
• *Auto-optimize forms suggestion*.
